title: 115_s1866
content: The "Hurricanes Harvey, Irma, and Maria Education Relief Act of 2017" defines terms like "affected area" and "affected student" in relation to disasters declared under the Stafford Disaster Relief Act. It aims to allocate and use campus-based higher education assistance for individuals impacted by these hurricanes. The "Hurricanes Harvey, Irma, and Maria Education Relief Act of 2017" provides assistance to students affected by the hurricanes. Eligibility includes enrollment in an affected area, being a dependent student with parents in an affected area, or suffering direct economic hardship due to the hurricanes. The Act refers to the Higher Education Act of 1965 for the definition of an institution of higher education. The "Hurricanes Harvey, Irma, and Maria Education Relief Act of 2017" allows for waivers of the non-federal share requirement for institutions of higher education in affected areas for award years 2016-2018 under the Higher Education Act of 1965. The Secretary may waive the non-Federal share requirement for institutions of higher education that enrolled affected students. Funds returned under certain sections of the Higher Education Act of 1965 will be reallocated by the Secretary. The Secretary may waive allocation reductions for eligible institutions of higher education in certain circumstances, such as returning more than 10 percent of their allocation. Eligible institutions must participate in the program and be located in an affected area or have enrolled affected students. The Secretary has the authority to reallocate excess allocations to institutions of higher education in affected areas for the needs of affected students in award year 2017-2018. Waiver authority allows for modifications to ensure assistance is provided under the Higher Education Act of 1965. The Secretary can reallocate funds to eligible institutions of higher education for programs authorized under the Higher Education Act of 1965. Funds with expiring availability dates can be extended until September 30, 2018, for specific purposes. The Secretary can reallocate funds to eligible institutions of higher education under the Higher Education Act of 1965. Funds that would otherwise lapse on September 30, 2017, can be reallocated according to specific guidelines. This section is designated as an emergency requirement. The Secretary must submit a report by October 1, 2018, to relevant committees on the total assistance received by each eligible institution. The Higher Education Act allows for the reallocation of funds to eligible institutions of higher education. The provisions of this act will no longer be effective after September 30, 2018. Additionally, amendments are made to the Elementary and Secondary Education Act regarding Project SERV and equitable services for children and teachers in private schools.
